e386d5a8e862bbe74a5bec2f7b886df7 (14:02): hey i got an idea

e386d5a8e862bbe74a5bec2f7b886df7 (14:02): you know the nextell cellphones with the push to talk

e386d5a8e862bbe74a5bec2f7b886df7 (14:03): i want to write a 2-way push to talk system
e386d5a8e862bbe74a5bec2f7b886df7 (14:04): pc thing
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:04): you think it could be done?
e386d5a8e862bbe74a5bec2f7b886df7 (14:04): its probably already been done
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:04): well do it better ;)

d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:22): Shin-Ra, why not cut out the link table and just link straight to UserID from DSProfile
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:22): will save you a lot of joins later on, and as each user can only have 1 profile (presumably) you might as well
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:23): so just delete the inner link right?
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:23): okay so now how do you i link the constrants now
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:24): rename UseProfileID to UserName and do it that way?

d720019c1e1dbf88f38fedb262134205 (14:33): anyone here installed the Win SDK 6.0 (RC ) ? i have a question.. like its gone half way through, and now its installing help files.. and i want to resume at a later time.. do you think i can hit cancel? or will hitting cancel start the installation all over again next time? :p
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:33): ja
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:33): i'd expect cancel to do what it says on the tin, so to speak
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:34): Shin - add a field UserID
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:34): foreign key
d720019c1e1dbf88f38fedb262134205 (14:35): Shin-Ra, ya for which question ? :p
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:35): urs
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:35): it's a phrase they use to advertise paint in the uk "does what it says on the tin"
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:35): means it does what it says
d720019c1e1dbf88f38fedb262134205 (14:36): oh i cancelled it.. :p
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:36): w-h, okay I have Username PK -> DSUsers Username PK
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:37): why don't you link on UserID
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:37): w-h, http://img219.imageshack.us/img219/6313/untitledmt6.jpg
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:38): oh cause im doing something like myspace ;)
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:38): well, that will work, but ideally you should put an ID into DSProfile
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:38): (2 secs)
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:38): ok
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:39): DSUSers: (UserID, PK | UserName, UNIQUE) | DSProfile: (ProfileID, PK | UserID)
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:39): then link the two UserID fields
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:40): do I make DSProfile ProfileID PK and also UserID right?
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:41): UserID doesn't need to be a PK, just UNIQUE
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (14:42): I would normally have the UserID be the PK and the UserName simply be UNIQUE
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (14:43): otherwise you have to start putting UserName into other tables
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (14:43): and it becomes tricky to allow someone to change their username
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:43): yeah, UserName is first table should also just be unique
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:43): you don't want multiple PKs
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:43): Okay i did what w-h said
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:43): just have auto IDs for all PKs
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:44): I have DSUsers(UserID PK | Username & Email | UNIQUE) and DSProfile(UserID PK I++)
d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (14:45): well, that isn't quite what i said... but hey
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:45): and a Relationship( UserID )
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:47): Cause I have to have the Username and User profile the same. I'm not gong to allow username changes
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (14:47): why not?

a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:48): well its not gonig to be a forum. Its like a myspace thing. Everyone site like those never allow name changes. And if the user wants a new name they are going to have to make a new profile
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:49): It would be kinda of pointless to allow username changes
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (14:49): ok, but I think the design should work on user id, not name
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (14:49): or you'll end up regretting it
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:49): yeah I did that
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:50): Okay. Now this comes the problem right here. Is how I'm going to have the userid on dsprofile match up to the dsusers on signup
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (14:53): Cause i am going to have one page for the sign up then when the user successfully signs up they go to a new page and fills out the profile
e386d5a8e862bbe74a5bec2f7b886df7 (14:57): whats in the exhaust of my gas furnace

e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (15:01): anyone know where the language identifiers like en-GB come from? I know the 'en' probably comes from ISO 639-2, but I can't see where the 'variant' bit is laid out
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (15:04): anyone?
a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (15:09): do I do SELECT * FROM DSProfile INNER JOIN DSUsers ON DSProfile.UserID = DSUsers.UserID WHERE DSUsers.UserID = @UserID or something like that?
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (15:28): List.Contains seems to ignore the fact that items in it implement IComparable
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (15:28): not too useful
f4c73dd6ebee4426eb5e0e9a1909e589 (15:35): it uses EqualityComparer<T>'s default
f4c73dd6ebee4426eb5e0e9a1909e589 (15:35): which for bytes is ByteEqualityComparer
f4c73dd6ebee4426eb5e0e9a1909e589 (15:35): GenericEqualityComparer if it's assignable via IEquatable<T>
f4c73dd6ebee4426eb5e0e9a1909e589 (15:36): NullableEqualityComparer for nulls
f4c73dd6ebee4426eb5e0e9a1909e589 (15:36): and ObjectEqualityComparer for others.
f4c73dd6ebee4426eb5e0e9a1909e589 (15:36): I would suggest you add IEquatable to your class.
f4c73dd6ebee4426eb5e0e9a1909e589 (15:36): it's easy to daisy chain it onto IComparable
1cf2e819eddaaff3d5bbea26ffb4f526 (15:37): sup rikkus damieng
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (15:53): oh, IEquatable
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (15:53): didn't know that existed
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (15:53): thanks damieng
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (15:53): hi Priest-of-Psi, damieng, anyone else who crept in

e43cff151e4e47b59e32eadd40c140d1 (15:55): what is the best practice to obtain a result if i have a hashtable with keys and values and a object and i want to check if the object belongs to the keys array from the hashtable?

d53a9ce77f40534cd0a1ee00cb6b8f3f (15:56): iterate through .Keys i guess
